news_header: Sam Nujoma, Namibia's first elected president and activist, died at 95.
news_original_title: Namibia's 'founding father' Sam Nujoma dies at 95
news_text: Sam Nujoma, the activist and guerrilla leader who became Namibia's first elected president, passed away at the age of 95. The Namibian Presidency announced his death on social media, expressing deep sorrow. Nujoma had been hospitalized for treatment three weeks prior but succumbed to his illness. He is survived by his wife and children. A founding member of SWAPO, Nujoma is celebrated for leading the fight against South Africa's occupation and for his role in Namibia's independence, officially becoming president in 1990.
